poker.handCategories

Class HandCategory

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.handCategories.HandCategory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<HandCategory>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Flush, FullHouse, HighCard, OnePair, Quads, Straight, StraightFlush, Trips, TwoPair

    public abstract class HandCategory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<HandCategory>
    HandCategory is the abstract base class for the different hand types you can have at showdown.

      • HandCategory

        protected HandCategory(int ordinal,
            Hand h)
        Creates a new hand category.
        Parameters:
        ordinal - an order number for the hand category. The lower the number, the stronger the hand.
        h - the hand associated with the hand category

      • calculateCardFrequencies

        protected static int[] calculateCardFrequencies(Hand h)
        Counts how many times each card rank occurs in a hand.
        Parameters:
        h - the hand to be evaluated
        Returns:
        an array containing the number of times each of the 13 card ranks occurs. The frequencies are in order of decreasing rank, so the number of aces is at index 0, and the number of deuces at index 12;

      • compareInternally

        protected abstract int compareInternally(HandCategory otherHandCategory)
        Compares two hands belonging to the same hand category.
        Parameters:
        otherHandCategory - the hand category this is compared against
        Returns:
        a negative integer if the hand in this wins against the hand in that, a positive integer if it loses and 0 if they tie

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(HandCategory other)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<HandCategory>

      • cardRank

        protected int cardRank(Hand h,
           int howManyOfAKind)
        Returns a number representing a rank, which occurs n times in hand. Returns -1 if no card occurs with the specified frequency
        Parameters:
        h - the hand to be evaluated
        howManyOfAKind - the number of times a rank should occur in the hand
        Returns:
        a number representing a rank, which occurs n times in hand. 0 represents an ace and 12 represents a deuce.

      • compareRanksInHand

        protected int compareRanksInHand(Hand h1,
                     Hand h2)
        Compares the card ranks of two sorted hands card by card.
        Parameters:
        h1 - the first hand
        h2 - the second hand
        Returns:
        a negative integer if a card in h1 has a higher rank than the corresponding card in h2, a positive integer if the rank of h2 is higher, 0 if all corresponding cards are of equal rank

      • compareKickers

        protected int compareKickers(int[] cardFrequenciesThis,
                 int[] cardFrequenciesOther)
        Compares the kickers in two poker hands, that is cards which are used to break ties
        Parameters:
        cardFrequenciesThis - an array containing the frequency of each rank in this
        cardFrequenciesOther - an array containing the frequency of each rank in other
        Returns:
        -1 if this has a bigger kicker than other, 1 if this has a smaller kicker, 0 otherwise
